greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime ideals of Z[sqrt(-5)] of norm n.
comment: It follows that the total number of ideals of norm n is A035170(n).
reference: David A. Cox, Primes of the form x^2+ny^2, Wiley, 1989.
A. Frohlich and M. J. Taylor, Algebraic number theory, Cambridge university press, 1991.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(n)=0 if n is not in A091727. If n is in A091727 and n is 2, 5 or a square then a(n)=1. Otherwise a(n)=2.
program: isA091727(n) = { my(ms = [1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 9], p, e=isprimepower(n,&p)); if(!e || e>2, 0, bitxor(e-1,!!vecsearch(ms,p%20))); };
results.author: _Paul Boddington_, Feb 02 2004
ext: Data section extended up to a(121) by _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 24 2020
